description.narrative: The Project involves an investment in Philippine Resources Savings Banking Corporation (PR Savings Bank or the Bank), an independent thrift bank in the Philippines, of (i) up to PHP650 million (~US$16 million equivalent) in redeemable preferred shares and (ii) an option to subscribe to up to PHP250 million (~US$6 million equivalent) in common shares. The Bank provides banking and other financial products and services mostly to the unbanked and underbanked population. IFCs proposed investment will increase the Banks regulatory capital in anticipation of the full implementation of Basel 1.5 by 2014, and support the expansion of the Banks SME and microfinance lending program to the rural areas of the Philippines. This project fits in with IFCs strategy to support the Philippine financial markets through equity type investments in local financial institutions that play a key role in increasing financial inclusion by providing access to finance to underserved sectors such as micro-entrepreneurs and small farmers.

The most significant impacts of this investment are expected to be: (1) strengthening the micro and small business sector (particularly in rural areas) by increasing access to finance for SMEs, micro-entrepreneurs and agricultural borrowers; and (2) contributing to the strengthening of corporate governance standards and environmental and social management in the Philippine thrift and rural banking sector
